definitions: A medical imaging technique that uses computer-processed combinations of multiple X-ray measurements taken from different angles to produce cross-sectional (tomographic) images of specific areas of a scanned object, allowing the user to see inside the object without cutting it open.
The image produced by this technique.
examples: The patient underwent computed tomography to assess the extent of the injury.
The computed tomography revealed a small tumor.
Advances in computed tomography have revolutionized diagnostic medicine.
